newsitem.title: GERMANY: German city bans suspected Kurdish demonstration.
newsitem.headline: German city bans suspected Kurdish demonstration.

text.p: The German city of Frankfurt on Friday banned a Turkish anti-government protest planned for Saturday, saying it believed the demonstration could be used by the outlawed Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

City authorities said they had reason to believe PKK supporters from Belgium and the Netherlands had been mobilised to attend the demonstration, and that it constituted a "grave threat to public safety".
Police prepared leaflets in German and Turkish telling demonstrators to turn back.

The PKK is fighting a guerrilla war against Turkish troops for autonomy or independence in the mainly Kurdish southeast. It has been banned in Germany since 1993 after organising several waves of attacks on Turkish properties in Germany.
Subsequent attempts to hold demonstrations have resulted in violent clashes with police.
